subNodes.conversationText: root

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
Castle Lor
Castle Lor stands to the north of the city near the government buildings. There is a heavy presence of well armed guards around the castle grounds.
Continue

A wooden platform has been raised to the east of the castle wall. A large crowd has gathered in front of it, jeering and pushing. Standing on the platform is a huge bare-chested man wearing a black hood. He leans calmly on the handle of his double headed axe, waiting.
Get closer to the platform

You join the crowd. There is a tense anticipation in the air, which suddenly erupts when a wild eyed man is dragged through the street towards the platform. Bits of rotten fruit and chunks of filth are hurled at the desparate man as the guards pull him onto the platform.
Continue

An officious looking man in a fine green doublet unfurls a scroll before the crowd. He clears his throat and begins to read.You strain to hear his soft, nasal voice above the hoarse shouting of the crowd.

"Preston Hurley, formerly of the City Watch. You have been sentenced to public execution for conspiring with the evil Cult of Ettin in acts of conspiracy against the Seneschal. The sentence will be carried out immediately. Do you have any final words?"
Continue

The wild eyed man looks desparately at the crowd. You notice that his gaze falls particularly on a pale young woman stood slightly apart from the crowd. Tears are running down her cheeks. An armed guard hovers by her shoulder. 

Preston Hurley shouts to the crowd. It is clearly an admission of guilt, although the noise of the crowd makes it hard to tell for sure.

The crowd roars its disapproval. Satisfied, the guard forces him to bend over the block.
This is the fun part! Keep watching.

The excecutioner strikes down with one enormous blow and cleaves Preston Hurley's head clear from his shoulders. An enormous cheer goes up from the crowd as the executioner holds the severed head up by its hair for the crowd to see.
Good stuff. Now, on to Castle Lor.
On second thoughts, go back to the city centre.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
You've seen enough. Leave the crowd and enter Castle Lor.
Leave the castle for now and return to the city centre.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
Ignore the platform and enter Castle Lor.
Castle Lor stands to the north of the city near the government buildings. There is a heavy presence of well armed guards around the castle grounds, for the most part looking surly and bored.
Enter the castle.
Leave the castle for now.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
The Weapon Shop
"Rork's Blades" is located near the bustling marketplace at the centre of Blackwinter. The outside of the shop is decorated with colourful banners and flags.
Enter the shop.
Leave the shop for now.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
The Great Temple

You stand before the Great Temple of Blackwinter. Smoke billows from vents in the giant dome and drifts into the sky like a black scar.

A handful of purple robed clerics slip past you, clutching leather bound books and eyeing you suspiciously.
Enter the temple.
Leave the temple for now.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
The Graveyard

You travel to the graveyard in the south of the city. The air is quiet and still, and the bustle of the city seems far away.

The entrance is through an ancient stone arch, decorated with faded carvings of roses and religious symbols.
Enter the graveyard.
You step through the arch into Blackwinter Graveyard.
Continue
Leave the graveyard for now.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
Half Moon Tavern
The Half Moon Tavern is almost hidden in the shadows of an alley in the west of the city. From inside you hear boistrous chatter and the strains of a female bard singing a well-known bawdy tune.
Enter the Half Moon Tavern.
Leave the Half Moon Tavern for now.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
The Guild

The Blackwinter Guild is located near the market district. It is an ornamental building, with gilded gold statues on the roof. It is not obviously guarded, but you are not fooled - this will be one of the most dangerous buildings in the entire city.
Enter the Guild.

You enter a long room, lined with pillars and tapestries.

Aren Kevrel makes her way over to you. 

"It is good to see you, <FullName>. I have a new quest that you will be interested in."
"Tell me."

"Something is undermining foundations in the city. We have heard stories of several houses collapsing, and even part of the city wall. It may be part of a larger plot to weaken the city defences. Find out what is causing this and put a stop to it."
"Very well."

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?

You enter a long room, lined with pillars and tapestries.

Aren Kevrel makes her way over to you.

"It is good to see you, <FullName>. Do you have anything to report?"
"Not yet."
"Return to me when you do."
Leave the Guild.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?

You enter a long room, lined with pillars and tapestries.

A tall, striking woman with impeccable posture makes her way over to you.

"Ah, you will be <FullName>. Dorian told me to expect you. I am Aren Kevrel, the Guild Mistress."
"Pleased to meet you."

"And you. I imagine we are to have something of a... business relationship, but I am pleased that we will conduct our matters with good courtesy."

"You are here because the Seneschal has provided signifiant rewards for the completion of certain tasks. Tasks that would be... inappropriate for his guards. And you also have a more delicate matter to attend to, yes?"
"What do you know about that?"

"It is my job to understand this city, <FullName>. To know its riddles and its players. I knew Baron Kelbor had been seized by the guard shortly after Ser Dorian did."

She reflects for a moment. 

"Possibly slightly earlier, actually."
Continue

"I do not know where he is now, or who is helping him. My shadows tell me that the Baron is widely held to be in league with this Cult of Ettin. I highly doubt it. Kelbor is a rational man, and that cult is nothing but a circus of charlatans."

"It is possible that he secured the services of thieves or bandits to help him escape. There may also be pawns at play that are still unknown to us here at the Guild, although I find that difficult to believe."
Continue

"In any case, it is the Guild's interests to find this Baron and ship him far away before the King's ire is drawn to us. And so we have worked with the Seneschal to place a sizeable bounty on the Baron's head, and we are in the process of listing notices and rewards for the infiltration and destruction of the many malignant forces in the region that might be working with him."
Continue

"If one of our bounty hunters finds the Baron, or if he is brought to us by mercenaries working to claim our rewards, you will be the first to hear of it. In the meantime, I appreciate that you may wish to carry out your own investigations. I am happy to give you details of the contracts - if you complete them, the rewards will be yours.."
Continue.
"So then, <FullName>. Ask your questions."
"Tell me more about the Guild."

"The Guild is part funded by the merchants and traders, and part funded by the Seneschal's office. Our funtion is to maintain trade. We primarily facilitate this through working against thieves, bandits, orcs, political intrigue, social unrest... anything, really, that might destablise the region and cause disruptions to trade."
"I have more questions."
"So then, <FullName>. Ask your questions."
"Do you get involved in illegal activity? If it assists trade?"
"Absolutely not."
Continue
"So then, <FullName>. Ask your questions."
"Do you have any ideas what Kelbor is doing here?"

She laughs.

"Yes, that's the question, isn't it! Why Blackwinter? My shadows tell me that he is unknown in this area, without friends or relatives or historical links. But there is certainly method in his madness. If you can solve that question, you will find your man."

"It is a shame that Dorian did not care to ask it. Dorian is a schemer, and you underestimate him at your peril. But he simply wants nothing to do with the intrigue of the King's Court."
Continue
"So then, <FullName>. Ask your questions."
"Tell me about the current bounties."

"A group of thieves has formed a base in the Blackwinter Graveyard. You may deal with them in any way you wish, but see that their operation is closed down and the graveyard is made safe again. The Guild will pay 100 gold on completion."

"In honesty, I doubt that they are involved with the missing Baron. But it would be wise to eliminate the city based operations from your enquiries first. If I were you, I would start your hunt there."
Continue
"When you wish to roam further abroad, then in the hills to the south west..."
Continue
"In the forest to the south..."
Continue

"Those are the current bounties. Please visit the Guild again on completion of a bounty and I will see you receive payment."

Aren smiles at you. "One last thing, <FullName>. I wish to introduce you to someone."

She claps her hands sharply; clearly a summons. Almost immediately, a young woman emerges from the shadows, making you start slightly. You hadn't realised anyone else was so close by.
Continue

The woman is small and slender, and carries a worn katana at her belt. She bows low to Aren Kevrel.

"Yes, Guildmistress?"
Continue

"<FullName>, may I introduce you to Mara Logar? Mara is one of our new recruits to the Guild. She is well trained in the ways of the bounty hunter. She lacks experience, but I think you will find her knowledge of the city and the surrounding environment invaluable. I suggest you take her with you in your hunt."
Continue
"It would be a pleasure to travel with you, <FullName>. No locks or traps will stand between you and your goal, I swear."
"Your help would be most welcome, Mara. Welcome aboard."

Mara gives you a surprisingly warm smile.

"Thank you. I won't let you down."
Continue
"Good luck, then. Return when you have something to report."
"Thank you." [Return to the city]

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
"I don't think I need any Guild spys on my team. Thanks, but no. I will do this without you."

"Very well."

Mara bows and retreats back into the shadows.
Continue
"For Grimwald's sake, <FullName>, I have no interest in spying on you. But very well. Return when you have something to report."
"I'll be back." [Return to the city]

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
"I'd still get to keep all the money, right?"

Mara laughs.

"Yes, you can keep the money if it means so much to you. I will simply travel with you and help until you chose to return to the King's Court."
"Well, okay then! Welcome aboard."

Mara gives you a surprisingly warm smile.

"Thank you. I won't let you down."
Continue
"Good luck, then. Return when you have something to report."
"Thank you." [Return to the city]

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
"Still... no, I don't think so. I don't like the idea of having a Guild spy with me."

"Very well."

Mara bows and retreats back into the shadows.
Continue
"For Grimwald's sake, <FullName>, I have no interest in spying on you. But very well. Return when you have something to report."
"I'll be back." [Return to the city]

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
"I have no need of your help, or your contracts. I will find this Baron on my own."
"You surprise me. I have heard a great deal about you, but no one mentioned that you were a fool. Is this your final decision? You will find your path difficult without my help."
"I couldn't be more sure. Goodbye."
"Very well. I wish you luck."
Leave the Guild.

The Blackwinter Guild is located near the market district. It is an ornamental building, with gilded gold statues on the roof. It is not obviously guarded, but you are not fooled - this will be one of the most dangerous buildings in the entire city.
"Tell me about the current bounties and I'll think about it."

"A group of thieves has formed a base in the Blackwinter Graveyard. You may deal with them in any way you wish, but see that their operation is closed down and the graveyard is made safe again. The Guild will pay 100 gold on completion."

"In honesty, I doubt that they are involved with the missing Baron. But it would be wise to eliminate the city based operations from your enquiries first. If I were you, I would start your hunt there."
"Yeah yeah yeah. What do you want?"

"A little civility, for starters. I imagine we are to have something of a... business relationship, but there is no reason why we cannot conduct matters with good courtesy."

"You are here of course, because the Seneschal has provided signifiant rewards for the completion of certain tasks. Tasks that would be... inappropriate for his guards. And you also have a more delicate matter to attend to, yes?"
"What do you know about that?"

"It is my job to understand this city, <FullName>. To know its riddles and its players. I knew Baron Kelbor had been seized by the guard shortly after Ser Dorian did."

She reflects for a moment. 

"Possibly slightly earlier, actually."
Leave the Guildhall for now.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
The City Gates

The huge walls of Blackwinter loom before you. The iron gate is open.

Suddenly there is a deafening roar and the ground shakes violently beneath your feet. There is a thunderous explosion and a cloud of dust envelops the street. You cover your mouth with your cloak, coughing, your ears ringing.
Continue

When the dust clears, you see that one of the houses on the street has been reduced to rubble, seemingly having collapsed in on itself. A crowd has gathered by it, lifting stones and trying to rescue those that might be trapped within.

You don't see anything you can do to help, so you move on.
Leave the city through the iron gate.
Return to the city.

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
The huge walls of Blackwinter loom in front of you. The iron gate is open, and you are free to leave the city if you wish.
Leave the city.
Return to the city,

The city of Blackwinter is a sprawling maze of winding streets and dark alleys. Smoke rises in a dark plume from the Great Temple to the east of the city, and to the north is the forboding Castle Lor.

Your map also has directions to a recommended weapon shop and tavern, the graveyard, and the local Guildhall. 

Where do you wish to go?
